course_description: A comprehensive overview of the human body's structure and function.
An exploration of ethical issues in the medical field, including patient confidentiality and informed consent.
An introductory course on pharmacology, including drug classifications and mechanisms of action.
Hands-on training in essential clinical skills such as taking vital signs and performing basic procedures.
An overview of research methodologies and techniques used in medical studies.
The study of the functional changes that accompany diseases and medical conditions.
Training in the management of acute medical emergencies and trauma care.
An introduction to public health principles and the study of disease distribution and control.
Advanced training in the management of cardiac arrest and other cardiovascular emergencies.
An overview of the administrative and managerial aspects of running a healthcare facility.
